definition.name: NXunit_cell
definition.doc: Description of a unit cell, i.e., the crystal structure of a single thermodynamic phase.

field.name: crystallographic_database_identifier
field.doc: Identifier of an entry resolvable via crystallographic_database which was used for creating this structure model.

field.name: crystallographic_database
field.doc: Name of the crystallographic database to resolve crystallographic_database_identifier e.g. COD, ICSD, or others.

field.name: lattice_system
field.doc: A lattice system is a group of lattices with the same set of lattice point groups. For further information, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crystal_system.

field.name: space_group
field.doc: Crystallographic space group. A space group is the symmetry group of a repeating pattern in space. For further information, see International Table for Crystallography (https://it.iucr.org/).

field.name: point_group
field.doc: Crystallographic point group. A crystallographic point group is a set of symmetry operations, corresponding to one of the point groups in three dimensions, such that each operation (perhaps followed by a translation) would leave the structure of a crystal unchanged. This field should use Schoenflies notation (see Schoenflies, A., Krystallsysteme und Krystallstructur, 1891). For further information, see https://dictionary.iucr.org/Point_group.

field.name: laue_group
field.doc: Laue group (also called Laue class). The Laue classes are eleven geometric crystal classes containing centrosymmetric crystallographic types of point groups and their subgroups. When absorption is negligible and Friedel's law applies, it is impossible to distinguish by diffraction between a centrosymmetric point group and one of its non-centrosymmetric subgroups; only point groups belonging to different Laue classes can then be distinguished. For further information, see https://dictionary.iucr.org/Laue_class.

field.name: a_b_c
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell parameters a, b, and c

field.name: base_vector_a
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell vector a

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: For definining which coordinate system the unit cell vector a is defined in.

field.name: base_vector_b
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell vector b

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: For definining which coordinate system the unit cell vector b is defined in.

field.name: base_vector_c
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell vector c

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: For definining which coordinate system the unit cell vector c is defined in.

field.name: alpha_beta_gamma
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell angles alpha, beta, and gamma

field.name: volume
field.doc: Volume of the unit cell

field.name: is_centrosymmetric
field.doc: True if space group is considered a centrosymmetric one. False if space group is considered a non-centrosymmetric one. Centrosymmetric has all types and combinations of symmetry elements (translation, rotational axis, mirror planes, center of inversion) Non-centrosymmetric compared to centrosymmetric is constrained (no inversion). Chiral compared to non-centrosymmetric is constrained (no mirror planes).

field.name: is_chiral
field.doc: True if space group is considered a chiral one. False if space group is consider a non-chiral one.

field.name: phase_identifier
field.doc: Identifier for the phase. The value 0 is reserved for the unknown phase which represents the null-model that no phase model was sufficiently significantly confirmed.

field.name: phase_name
field.doc: Trivial name of the phase/alias.

field.name: atom_identifier
field.doc: Labels for each atom position

field.name: atom
field.doc: The hash value :math:`H` is :math:`H = Z + N \cdot 256` with :math:`Z` the number of protons and :math:`N` the number of neutrons of each isotope respectively. :math:`Z` and :math:`N` have to be 8-bit unsigned integers. For the rationale behind this `M. KÃ¼hbach et al. (2021) <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927621012241>`_

field.name: atom_positions
field.doc: Atom positions x, y, z.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: Reference to an instance of NXcoordinate_system whereby the positions can be resolved.

field.name: atom_occupancy
field.doc: Relative occupancy of the atom position.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: For definining which coordinate system the unit cell parameters are defined in.
